results.description: Use 5-day time-series zscore of daily change as a cross-sectional momentum signal. SUGGESTION1: used multiple fields? No, single strong field sufficient (mcr38_change with high coverage & userCount). SUGGESTION2: no vector fields present so not applied. SUGGESTION3: coverage=0.9795>0.6 so ts_backfill not needed. SUGGESTION4: used high userCount/alphaCount field (mcr38_change userCount=344). Confidence=0.65.

Combine momentum and liquidity: scale 5-day zscore(change) by yesterday volume to favor high-volume movers. S1: used 2 fields (mcr38_change, mcr38_volume). S2: none. S3: both coverages high >0.95. S4: both have high user/alpha counts (change vol). Confidence=0.68.
Short-term mean reversion: negative of 3-day zscore of percent change. S1: single field mcr38_percent_change; S2: none; S3: coverage high; S4: percent_change has good counts. Confidence=0.6.

Multiply raw 1-day change by indicator strength to emphasize signals with historically better performance. S1: used mcr38_change and mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none; S3: both coverage>0.95; S4: strength_rating userCount=107, change high userCount. Confidence=0.62.

Use longterm percent composite as slow trend predictor, cross-sectionally ranked. S1: single field mcr38_longterm_percent; S2: no vectors; S3: coverage ok; S4: longterm_percent has moderate userCount. Confidence=0.58.

Signal when short-term percent and long-term percent diverge: favor positive shortterm minus longterm. S1: used mcr38_shorttermpercent and mcr38_longterm_percent. S2: none. S3: both coverages high. S4: shortterm has moderate counts. Confidence=0.64.

Use ADX strength to filter momentum: multiply 5-day zscore(change) by adx_strength. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_adx_strength used. S2: none. S3: both coverage>0.95. S4: adx_strength has good alphaCount. Confidence=0.66.

Use BB strength reading times daily percent change to capture breakout conviction. S1: mcr38_percent_change and mcr38_bb_strength used. S2: none. S3: coverage ok. S4: bb_strength has high userCount (370 for direction but strength lesser), still useful. Confidence=0.6.

Rank instruments by today high-minus-low (volatility spike) using ts_zscore over 10 days. S1: used mcr38_high and mcr38_low (2 fields). S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: high/low fields have acceptable counts. Confidence=0.59.

Use yesterday open and last to find gap continuation: 1-day ts_delta of last relative to open. S1: mcr38_last and mcr38_open used. S2: none. S3: both coverage high. S4: last has high alphaCount. Confidence=0.57.

Use MACD 20/50 strength to scale short momentum (3-day zscore(change)). S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_macd_20_50_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: macd strength alphaCounts moderate. Confidence=0.63.

Mean-revert using CCI40 strength as damping on percent change zscore. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_cci_40_strength. S2: none. S3: both high coverage. S4: cci_40_strength counts moderate. Confidence=0.55.

Multiply 5-day returns zscore by trendspotter strength to prefer confirmed trends. S1: ts_zscore of mcr38_change and mcr38_trendspotter_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: trendspotter_strength alphaCount moderate. Confidence=0.65.

results.idea: Percent change momentum with winsorized size
results.description: Cross-sectional quantile of percent change after winsorizing to reduce outliers. S1: mcr38_percent_change. S2: none. S3: coverage ok. S4: percent_change has solid usage. Confidence=0.6.

Rank instruments by ratio of volume to its 20-day mean (volume surge). S1: mcr38_volume used twice (ts_mean + divide) but single field. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: volume userCount=223. Confidence=0.62.

Scale daily change by recent stddev (10-day) inverse to favor stable directional moves. S1: mcr38_change & ts_std_dev(change). Only change field used with ts operator. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change has many users. Confidence=0.64.

results.idea: Consensus across medium and overall percent
results.description: Average medium-term percent and overall percent to capture consistent signals. S1: mcr38_mediumterm_percent and mcr38_overall_percent. S2: none. S3: both high coverage. S4: moderate userCounts. Confidence=0.56.

Identify instruments where direction rating is strong but strength rating weak (possible fade). rank direction - strength. S1: mcr38_direction_rating & mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none. S3: both >0.95. S4: both have decent counts. Confidence=0.5.
Boost short momentum by PARA_50 strength (trend filter). S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_para_50_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: para strength moderate. Confidence=0.61.

Rank normalized last price returns via ts_quantile over 7 days for smoother momentum. S1: mcr38_last. S2: none. S3: last coverage high and alphaCount large. S4: used high alphaCount field. Confidence=0.59.

Use strengths of MA20 and MA100: prefer when MA20_strength >> MA100_strength (accelerating trend). S1: mcr38_ma_20_strength & mcr38_ma_100_strength. S2: none. S3: both coverages ~0.96. S4: userCounts moderate. Confidence=0.62.

Multiply short momentum by MA50 strength to prefer intermediate-term confirmation. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_ma_50_strength. S2: none. S3: both coverage high. S4: ma_50 strength counts moderate. Confidence=0.61.

Use difference in MACD 50/100 strength vs MACD 20/100 strength to find structural shifts. S1: mcr38_macd_50_100_strength & mcr38_macd_20_100_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: strengths have moderate alphaCounts. Confidence=0.54.

Multiply today's percent change zscore by trendspotter_strength to avoid false breakouts. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_trendspotter_strength. S2: none. S3: coverages high. S4: trendspotter has moderate counts. Confidence=0.63.

Average multiple strength ratings (ADX, BB) to create composite conviction measure. S1: mcr38_adx_strength & mcr38_bb_strength. S2: none. S3: coverages >0.94. S4: adx and bb strengths have reasonable alphaCounts. Confidence=0.57.

If an indicator's direction is weakening (direction low) but price jumped, expect reversion: negative change scaled by direction. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_bb_direction. S2: none. S3: bb_direction coverage high. S4: bb_direction userCount high. Confidence=0.52.

Combine overall_percent and strength_rating to pick strongly aligned moves: multiply composite percent by strength. S1: mcr38_overall_percent & mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none. S3: coverages high. S4: both have usable counts. Confidence=0.60.

Detect when 5-day momentum decelerates vs 1-day: ts_delta of ts_zscore(change,5) over 1 day negative implies slowing. S1: mcr38_change only (ts operators). S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change widely used. Confidence=0.53.

When big negative return occurs with low volume (no conviction), expect mean reversion: reverse(change) weighted by inverse volume surge. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: both fields strong. Confidence=0.58.

Favor instruments with positive change and low recent stddev scaled by trend strength. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_trendspotter_strength (ts_std_dev applied to change). S2: none. S3: coverages high. S4: fields moderate usage. Confidence=0.62.
Avoid outliers by winsorizing percent change then ranking. S1: mcr38_percent_change. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: percent_change common. Confidence=0.59.

Long instruments where change correlates positively with para_50_strength over 20 days (positive correlation implies follow-through). S1: ts_corr(mcr38_change, mcr38_para_50_strength, 20) uses 2 fields. S2: none. S3: both cover high. S4: para strength moderate. Confidence=0.55.

Rank instruments by low ts_std_dev of returns (stability) multiplied by positive recent returns to pick steady winners. S1: mcr38_change used with ts_std_dev. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change has high counts. Confidence=0.6.

Average MA20, MA50, MA100 strengths to create robust MA conviction. S1: mcr38_ma_20_strength & mcr38_ma_50_strength (two fields only; omit ma100 to respect 2-field limit) then combine with scalar average via add/divide. S2: none. S3: strengths cover high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.56.

If shorttermpercent positive but shorttermsignal weakening (strength low), expect pullback: reverse shorttermpercent weighted by shortterm strength. S1: mcr38_shorttermpercent & mcr38_shorttermpercent (use strength substitute is not available so use shorttermpercent alone reversed). S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: shorttermpercent moderate counts. Confidence=0.49.
Use longterm_percent times ADX strength to select durable trends. S1: mcr38_longterm_percent & mcr38_adx_strength. S2: none. S3: both >0.95. S4: fields have reasonable counts. Confidence=0.63.
Rank instruments by 10-day zscore of (high-low) to capture breakout volatility. S1: mcr38_high & mcr38_low. S2: none. S3: coverages high. S4: high/low counts moderate. Confidence=0.58.

Penalize price moves not confirmed by volume: quantile of change divided by volume (low confidence if volume huge). S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: both high coverage. S4: used high-count fields. Confidence=0.57.

Difference between MA50 strength and MACD20/50 strength to find momentum regime shifts. S1: mcr38_ma_50_strength & mcr38_macd_20_50_strength. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: moderate usage. Confidence=0.52.
Use ts_arg_min of change over 5 days to pick instruments hitting local minima for mean-reversion. S1: mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change common. Confidence=0.54.
Use information ratio of returns over 20 days (ts_ir) to pick persistent winners. S1: mcr38_change used in ts_ir. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change field widely used. Confidence=0.66.

High recent positive returns combined with low volume may indicate squeezes; rank change / volume zscore. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: both cover>0.95. S4: high counts. Confidence=0.5.

Prefer strong trend with low volatility: longterm_percent weighted by inverse ts_std_dev(change,10). S1: mcr38_longterm_percent & mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields have decent counts. Confidence=0.62.

Multiply 3-day change zscore by direction_rating to prefer moves aligned with directional score. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_direction_rating. S2: none. S3: coverages high. S4: direction_rating userCount=128. Confidence=0.61.

Add shorttermpercent and normalized last price quantile to capture both indicator and price momentum. S1: mcr38_shorttermpercent & mcr38_last. S2: none. S3: both high coverage. S4: last has strong alphaCount. Confidence=0.58.

Multiply percent_change by normalized strength_rating to emphasize reliable percent moves. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: both fields reasonable. Confidence=0.6.
Use difference of MA20 and MA100 strengths as proxy for crossover conviction. S1: mcr38_ma_20_strength & mcr38_ma_100_strength. S2: none. S3: both cover high. S4: moderate usage. Confidence=0.59.
Scale raw alpha by adx_strength to increase position in strong trends. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_adx_strength. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: adx fields have many alphas. Confidence=0.64.

Use ts_kurtosis of returns to avoid fat-tailed noisy names: multiply momentum by inverse kurtosis. S1: mcr38_change only (ts_kurtosis). S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change widely used. Confidence=0.55.

Reverse 3-day zscore(change) but reduce weight when volume surge (less mean reversion with high volume). S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: both high coverage. S4: fields strong. Confidence=0.56.

Use yesterday's high relative to last (range/last) ranked by ts_zscore over 10 days to capture late strength. S1: mcr38_high & mcr38_last. S2: none. S3: coverages high. S4: both have moderate counts. Confidence=0.53.

Favor instruments with few NaNs in recent indicator (useful when coverage lower), but here coverage high so ts_count_nans=0 gives stability score. S1: mcr38_trendspotter_strength used with ts_count_nans. S2: none. S3: coverage high so ts_backfill not needed. S4: trendspotter moderate counts. Confidence=0.48.

Normalize percent change by composite strength (overall_percent) to prefer moves with high conviction per unit move. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_overall_percent. S2: none. S3: both >0.95. S4: fields moderate usage. Confidence=0.6.
Reduce influence of outliers by winsorizing 5-day zscore of change then rank. S1: mcr38_change only. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change high userCount. Confidence=0.61.

Multiply change zscore by difference between two MACD strengths to capture strengthening momentum. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_macd_50_100_strength and mcr38_macd_20_100_strength (two fields allowed? That would be three total incl change). To obey 2-field limit use macd_50_100_strength with change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.54.

results.idea: Percent change momentum scaled to 1-day open gap
results.description: If today's last vs open shows continuation, boost percent_change; use ts_delta(last,1) as proxy for gap. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_last. S2: none. S3: both cover well. S4: last has strong alphaCount. Confidence=0.55.
Rank instruments by ts_rank of change over 7 days to capture consistent movers. S1: mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: change widely used. Confidence=0.62.

Multiply overall strength by inverse group dispersion (here approximated by ts_std_dev of strength) to prefer uniform-strength names (single field used). S1: mcr38_strength_rating only. S2: none. S3: coverage>0.95. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.51.

results.idea: Percent change momentum with tail guard
results.description: Use tail to limit extreme percent changes before ranking to control outliers. S1: mcr38_percent_change. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: percent_change common. Confidence=0.58.

For low-volatility names (low ts_std_dev(change)), favor those with MACD strength > threshold: multiply inverse vol by macd strength. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_macd_50_100_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.6.

results.idea: Percent momentum scaled by para conviction
results.description: Boost percent moves where PARA_50_strength strong. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_para_50_strength. S2: none. S3: both cover high. S4: para strength moderate. Confidence=0.59.

results.idea: Change zscore filtered by trendspotter signal
results.description: If trendspotter_strength is high, keep momentum; else reverse. Implement multiply sign. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_trendspotter_strength. S2: none. S3: coverages high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.58.
Use product of returns over 5 days to capture persistent movers. S1: mcr38_change (ts_product). S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change widely measured. Confidence=0.60.

When strength high but momentum low, expect mean-reversion or delayed move; signal = strength - recent change zscore. S1: mcr38_strength_rating & mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.52.
Use ts_ir of percent_change over 10 days to find names with high mean/volatility profile. S1: mcr38_percent_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: percent_change used. Confidence=0.63.
Add zscores of percent change and volume to capture momentum with liquidity. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: both fields used widely. Confidence=0.6.

Multiply overall_strength by inverse recent volatility to find strong, stable trends. S1: mcr38_strength_rating & mcr38_change (ts_std_dev). S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: both fields moderate. Confidence=0.61.

results.idea: High percent change but weak strength fade
results.description: Short signals where percent change high but overall_strength low: subtract strength*scale from percent_change. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields common. Confidence=0.51.
ts_delta of ts_zscore(change,5) over 3 days measures acceleration; rank high accel. S1: mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change strong. Confidence=0.62.
Use (high-low)/last zscore over 7 days to capture normalized intraday expansion. S1: mcr38_high & mcr38_low (two fields). S2: none. S3: coverages high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.56.
Multiply percent_change by volume zscore to favor liquid breakouts. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: cover high. S4: fields widely used. Confidence=0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with tail control and normalization
results.description: Compute ts_zscore(change,5), winsorize it and apply quantile to reduce outliers. S1: mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change frequent. Confidence=0.62.

Subtract MA strength from MACD strength to find names where momentum indicators disagree. S1: mcr38_macd_50_100_strength & mcr38_ma_50_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.5.

Average shorttermpercent and mediumterm_percent to find cross-horizon agreement. S1: mcr38_shorttermpercent & mcr38_mediumterm_percent. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.57.

If indicator strength drops (ts_delta negative) but price unchanged, expect reversal: reverse when ts_delta(strength,3) <0. S1: mcr38_bb_strength only with ts_delta. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: bb_strength userCount high. Confidence=0.48.

Identify names with low recent volatility but sudden range expansion: ratio of today's range to ts_std_dev(change,20). S1: mcr38_high & mcr38_low with mcr38_change via ts_std_dev (but two-field limit: use high and change). Use subtract(high,last) / ts_std_dev(change). S2: none. S3: cover high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.52.

Divide MA50 strength by MA100 strength to find relatively stronger intermediate trends. S1: mcr38_ma_50_strength & mcr38_ma_100_strength. S2: none. S3: cover high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.53.

Multiply trendspotter_strength by volume zscore to favor high-conviction liquid names. S1: mcr38_trendspotter_strength & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.6.

Only trade when overall percent high and strength_rating > threshold using if_else: apply percent change else NaN. S1: mcr38_overall_percent & mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.55.
Normalize 10-day change to [0,1] via ts_scale and rank cross-sectionally. S1: mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change commonly used. Confidence=0.61.

Use direction ratings (numeric) to create signed signal: positive when direction>3 else negative. S1: mcr38_ma_20_direction used (direction numeric). S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: direction userCount moderate. Confidence=0.5.

results.idea: Percent change momentum with quantile normalization
results.description: Apply quantile to percent change directly to remove cross-sectional skew. S1: mcr38_percent_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: field widely used. Confidence=0.6.
Rank instruments by volume / ts_quantile(volume,20) to catch extraordinary volume days. S1: mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: volume used widely. Confidence=0.58.

Prefer fields with historically high alphaCount; build alphas using mcr38_last and mcr38_change which have high alphaCounts per SUGGESTION4. S1: mcr38_last & mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: explicitly used high alphaCount fields to increase reliability. Confidence=0.63.

results.idea: Short-term reversal when MA strength falls
results.description: If MA20 strength decreases (ts_delta negative) while price spiked, expect reversal: reverse change when ts_delta(ma_20_strength,3)<0. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_ma_20_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.49.

results.idea: High conviction long: overall_percent * low vol
results.description: Multiply overall_percent by inverse recent volatility to pick strong, stable uptrends. S1: mcr38_overall_percent & mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: cover high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.62.
Identify large open-close gaps (ts_delta(last,1)) and rank for reversion when volume low. S1: mcr38_last & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: both have good counts. Confidence=0.5.

Multiply 5-day change zscore by CCI60 strength to select validated momentum. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_cci_60_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: cci_60_strength has moderate alphaCount. Confidence=0.61.

Multiply today's range (high-low) zscore by trend strength to capture conviction breakouts. S1: mcr38_high & mcr38_low (range) and mcr38_trendspotter_strength—must keep to 2 fields: use range (high & low) only. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.55.
Scale 10-day change into [0,1], winsorize and rank. S1: mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: high coverage. S4: change used heavily. Confidence=0.61.

Use ts_corr of percent_change and strength_rating over 20 days to find names where moves align with strength. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none. S3: cover high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.55.
Use ts_zscore of longterm_percent over 30 days to capture accelerating long-term trends. S1: mcr38_longterm_percent. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: field moderate counts. Confidence=0.57.

results.idea: Short-term percent momentum with median filter
results.description: Replace extreme shorttermpercent using tail then rank to avoid spikes. S1: mcr38_shorttermpercent. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: field moderate. Confidence=0.56.

results.idea: Momentum consistency via ts_count_nans on change
results.description: Favor instruments with consistent data (low NaNs) in returns (stability signal). S1: mcr38_change used with ts_count_nans. S2: none. S3: coverage high so counts low. S4: change frequent. Confidence=0.47.

Multiply today's percent change by (overall_percent/10) to scale moves by composite percent. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_overall_percent. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.59.

ts_corr(ma_50_strength, change, 20) to find names where MA strength predicts returns. S1: mcr38_ma_50_strength & mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderately used. Confidence=0.54.

results.idea: Percent change momentum trimmed by winsorize
results.description: Trim extreme percent changes using winsorize then apply zscore. S1: mcr38_percent_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: percent_change well used. Confidence=0.6.

results.idea: Volume momentum cross with percent change
results.description: Add zscores of percent_change and volume to capture both momentum and liquidity. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: both fields strong. Confidence=0.6.

Select names with positive longterm_percent but low ts_std_dev(change) to prefer stable trends. S1: mcr38_longterm_percent & mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.61.

Identify overbought names where trendspotter_strength >> percent change: subtract percent from trendster. S1: mcr38_trendspotter_strength & mcr38_percent_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.49.
Boost 5-day change zscore with CCI40 strength as confirmation. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_cci_40_strength. S2: none. S3: both >0.94. S4: cci_40_strength moderate. Confidence=0.6.

Prefer high overall percent but penalize high volatility by subtracting ts_std_dev(change,10). S1: mcr38_overall_percent & mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.57.

When momentum low but ADX strong, expect upcoming move; multiply inverse zscore(change) by adx_strength. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_adx_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: adx fields good. Confidence=0.55.
Compute ts_zscore(change,5), then scale to booksize for portfolio construction. S1: mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change high alphaCount. Confidence=0.62.
Average MA20 and MA50 strengths to form intermediate-term conviction. S1: mcr38_ma_20_strength & mcr38_ma_50_strength. S2: none. S3: cover high. S4: counts moderate. Confidence=0.56.

Flag names where range high but volume not surged: subtract volume zscore from range zscore. S1: mcr38_high/mcr38_low combined into range & mcr38_volume (two fields allowed? must use either range or volume; use high and volume). Use subtract(ts_zscore(subtract(high,last)), ts_zscore(volume)). To respect 2-field limit use high & volume. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.45.

results.idea: Percent change plus last price signal
results.description: Combine percent_change and last price quantile to capture both relative and absolute moves. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_last. S2: none. S3: both cover high. S4: last high alphaCount. Confidence=0.58.

results.idea: Momentum fade when multiple strengths weaken
results.description: If MA and MACD strengths both drop (negative ts_delta), expect reversal: use sum of ts_delta(ma20,3) and ts_delta(macd50_100,3) and reverse sign. S1: mcr38_ma_20_strength & mcr38_macd_50_100_strength. S2: none. S3: cover high. S4: moderate. Confidence=0.46.
Bucket shorttermpercent into quantiles for robust cross-sectional ranking. S1: mcr38_shorttermpercent. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: field moderate. Confidence=0.57.

results.idea: Last price breakouts with ADX confirmation
results.description: Rank ts_quantile(last,7) multiplied by adx_strength to favor breakout names with strong trend. S1: mcr38_last & mcr38_adx_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: last alphaCount high. Confidence=0.63.
Use ts_std_dev(percent_change,10) inverse multiplied by percent_change to favor stable moves. S1: mcr38_percent_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: field common. Confidence=0.6.
Multiply change by sign(strength_rating-3) to trade only when strength direction aligned. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.58.

Use range zscore multiplied by macd_20_50_strength to pick confirmed breakouts. S1: mcr38_high & mcr38_low (range) or use high and macd to stay within 2 fields: use subtract(high,last) & macd_strength? Use high & mcr38_macd_20_50_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: macd strength moderate. Confidence=0.55.
Use ts_ir(change, 10) multiplied by volume to favor high S/N and liquid names. S1: mcr38_change & mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: good counts. Confidence=0.62.

If longterm_percent drops sharply (ts_delta < 0) but shorttermpercent high, expect mean reversion: reverse shorttermpercent when ts_delta(longterm,3)<-threshold. S1: mcr38_shorttermpercent & mcr38_longterm_percent. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.47.

results.idea: Percent change scaled by strength percentile
results.description: Scale percent_change by quantile(strength) to prioritize top-strength names. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_strength_rating. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.59.
Winsorize last price then compute ts_zscore to avoid extreme names. S1: mcr38_last. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: last high alphaCount. Confidence=0.58.
Rank instruments by ratio of today's volume to 5-day mean volume (volume spike). S1: mcr38_volume. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: volume decent userCount. Confidence=0.57.

results.idea: Strength minus recent change as anomaly
results.description: Flag names where strength far exceeds recent price move (potential lagging move). signal = strength - ts_zscore(change,5). S1: mcr38_strength_rating & mcr38_change. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.5.

Multiply 3-day percent change zscore by ma_50_strength to favor intermediate confirmation. S1: mcr38_percent_change & mcr38_ma_50_strength. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: moderate counts. Confidence=0.6.

Average trendspotter_strength and overall_percent to form a composite conviction metric. S1: mcr38_trendspotter_strength & mcr38_overall_percent. S2: none. S3: cover high. S4: fields moderate. Confidence=0.56.

Pick names with positive change and low ts_std_dev(change,20): multiply sign(change) by inverse volatility. S1: mcr38_change only. S2: none. S3: coverage high. S4: change high userCount. Confidence=0.6.
